tools.name: FreeGS4E
tools.one_line_profile: Free boundary Grad-Shafranov solver for time evolution in tokamak plasmas
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based solver for the Grad-Shafranov equation, specifically designed for evolutive free-boundary tokamak plasma equilibrium simulations. It supports time-dependent modeling of plasma shapes and positions.

tools.name: FreeGSNKE
tools.one_line_profile: Evolutive free-boundary tokamak plasma equilibrium simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A Python code for simulating the evolution of free-boundary tokamak plasma equilibria. It solves the Grad-Shafranov equation to model plasma magnetic configurations and their time evolution.

tools.name: EFIT.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia routines for reading EFIT geqdsk files
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library designed to read and process EFIT geqdsk files, which are standard formats for storing magnetic equilibrium reconstructions in fusion devices.

tools.name: disruption-py
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based framework for disruption analysis of fusion plasmas
tools.detailed_description: An open-source scientific framework developed by MIT-PSFC for the analysis of disruptions in fusion plasmas, specifically tailored for AI/ML applications in disruption prediction and mitigation.

tools.name: plasma-python
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning disruption prediction package for fusion plasmas
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning package from PPPL for predicting disruptions in tokamak plasmas. It includes tools for data processing, model training, and evaluation specifically for fusion disruption datasets.

tools.name: eqtools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for magnetic equilibria in tokamak plasmas
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for working with magnetic equilibrium data in tokamak plasmas. It provides functionality for coordinate mapping, flux surface analysis, and interfacing with equilibrium codes.

tools.name: DESC
tools.detailed_description: A suite for solving and optimizing 3D MHD equilibria in stellarators. It uses a pseudo-spectral method to compute high-accuracy equilibrium solutions and supports optimization of coil shapes and plasma properties.

tools.name: FOCUS
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible Optimized Coils Using Space curves
tools.detailed_description: A code for designing and optimizing modular coils for stellarators. It uses a space curve representation to optimize coil geometry for desired magnetic field properties.

tools.name: STELLOPT
tools.detailed_description: The state-of-the-art code for stellarator optimization. It integrates with equilibrium solvers like VMEC to optimize plasma confinement properties and coil configurations.

tools.name: FreeGS
tools.one_line_profile: Free boundary Grad-Shafranov solver for plasma equilibrium in tokamaks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that solves the free-boundary Grad-Shafranov equation to determine the plasma equilibrium configuration in tokamak fusion devices. It supports coil geometry definition and plasma profile specification.

tools.name: OMAS
tools.one_line_profile: Ordered Multidimensional Array Structure for ITER IMAS data interface
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to simplify the interface with the ITER Integrated Modeling and Analysis Suite (IMAS) data structure. It provides a convenient way to handle hierarchical scientific data in fusion research.

tools.name: SIMSOPT
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and Optimization code for stellarator design
tools.detailed_description: A framework for the optimization of stellarator fusion devices. It integrates physics simulation codes with optimization algorithms to design magnetic coils and plasma configurations.

tools.name: PCSSP
tools.one_line_profile: Plasma Control System Simulation Platform for ITER
tools.detailed_description: A simulation platform developed by the ITER Organization for designing and testing plasma control systems. It allows for the simulation of plasma evolution and control loop responses.

tools.name: SOLPS-ITER
tools.one_line_profile: Scrape-Off Layer Plasma Simulation Code for ITER
tools.detailed_description: A code package for simulating the plasma scrape-off layer (SOL) and divertor physics in tokamak devices. It is a standard tool for edge plasma modeling in the fusion community.

tools.name: OpenReactor
tools.one_line_profile: Control and data logging system for IEC fusion reactors
tools.detailed_description: An open-source control, monitoring, and data logging platform designed for Inertial Electrostatic Confinement (IEC) nuclear fusion reactors. It provides interfaces for hardware control and experimental data acquisition.

tools.name: ESSOS
tools.one_line_profile: e-Stellarator Simulation and Optimization Suite for magnetic configuration design
tools.detailed_description: ESSOS (e-Stellarator Simulation and Optimization Suite) is a Python-based tool designed for the simulation and optimization of stellarator fusion devices. It focuses on magnetic field configuration, plasma surface optimization, and coil design to support nuclear fusion research.
